concise_definition: n. 诅咒, 祸患; v. 诅咒, 骂人

definitions.explanation_en: A solemn utterance intended to invoke a supernatural power to inflict harm or punishment on someone or something, often due to anger or revenge.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种庄严的言辞，旨在召唤超自然力量对某人或某物施加伤害或惩罚，通常源于愤怒或报复心理。
definitions.example_en: The witch placed a curse on the village, causing all the crops to wither.
definitions.example_cn: 女巫对村庄施加了诅咒，导致所有庄稼枯萎。

definitions.explanation_en: A condition or situation regarded as a source of persistent misfortune or suffering; something that brings repeated bad luck.
definitions.explanation_cn: 一种被视为持续不幸或痛苦根源的状态或情境；带来反复厄运的事物。
definitions.example_en: The old house was said to be under a curse—every owner met with tragedy.
definitions.example_cn: 据说那栋老房子被下了诅咒——每一位主人都遭遇了不幸。

definitions.explanation_en: To utter a curse against someone, expressing anger or wishing harm upon them.
definitions.explanation_cn: 对某人说出诅咒之语，表达愤怒或希望其遭受不幸。
definitions.example_en: He cursed loudly when he stubbed his toe on the table.
definitions.example_cn: 他撞到脚趾时大声咒骂起来。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause something to be afflicted by a curse or to bring about misfortune through supernatural means.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过超自然手段使某物遭受诅咒，或导致其陷入厄运。
definitions.example_en: Legends say the treasure was cursed by the ancient king to protect it from thieves.
definitions.example_cn: 传说中，这笔财宝被古代国王诅咒，以保护它免受盗贼侵害。

comparison.analysis: “Curse” 作为名词时，强调一种超自然的、带有恶意的惩罚性力量；而 “hex”（巫术诅咒）更具体地指向巫术或魔法仪式中的咒语，常用于民间传说，语义范围更窄。
“Swear” (咒骂) 指使用粗俗或亵渎的语言表达愤怒，通常是口头发泄，不涉及超自然力量。而 “curse” 可以是纯粹的语言发泄，也可以是相信能引发超自然后果的正式诅咒，语义层次更深。
“Blessing” (祝福) 是 “curse” 的反义词，指祈求神灵赐予恩惠、保护或好运。两者在文化语境中常形成对立：一个带来灾祸，一个带来福祉，常用于宗教、神话或文学中的道德对比。
